Creating a Radius Provider

 1. In the Domain Configuration screen, ensure that the Realm selection is Radius, and then select Provider Group from the list. click ‘+’. The Radius Providers screen is displayed.

 2. In the Radius Providers screen, click the ‘+’ icon. Add/Edit Radius Provider page is displayed.

 3. In the Add/Edit Radius Provider page, enter the required fields according to your provider.

Figure 3-7 Radius Provider

Table 3-2 Radius Parameters

Field Name

Description

Hostname

The hostname/IP address on which the Radius provider resides.

Order

The provider sequential order to authenticate users in Cisco UCS ADA domain. The sequential order for the provider can be defined up to 16.

Authorization Port

The port through which Cisco UCS ADA communicates with the Radius database.

Timeout

This defines the time limit for the web session to be terminated beyond the refresh request time period.

The time must be defined in secs between 60 and 172800. The default time period is 7200 secs.

Key

The SSL encryption key for the Radius database.

Confirm Key

The SSL encryption confirmation key for the Radius database.

Retries

The number of times to retry to connect to the database.

 4. Click Save to create an Radius provider.

Similarly, repeat step 2 and 3 to create as many RADIUS provider(s) you need.

 5. In the RADIUS Providers page, select the required provider(s) you wish to include in the group.

 6. Click the > button to add the providers in the RADIUS Providers Groups.

You can use the X button to remove providers from the group.

 7. After you have added all desired providers to the provider group, click Save & Return.
